citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The facility had one puppy death in a litter yesterday and another puppy was observed by the facility to not be interested
in suckling but has been taking some milk replacer. The licensee was concerned this puppy's problems might be the
same as the one that died but the attending veterinarian had not been contacted. The puppy was observed to have moist
gums but when compared with littermates' interest in suckling the dam, it was seen to be uninterested. Lack of
communication with the attending veterinarian on the health of this puppy might cause it to be in discomfort or have its
condition worsen. If an animal is unwell and the program of veterinary care does not instruct care for a condition, the
facility must contact the attending veterinarian to have the animals evaluated and follow the attending veterinarian's
treatment plan.
***Correct by the end of 4/20/2023.
NOTE: The inspection was paused and the licensee contacted the attending veterinarian who plans to visit and observe
the litter today.
The facility has pyrantel stored and that has been used that expired 5/2021. Expired medications might not work to
prevent/treat conditions or might make animals sick. Ensure that expired medications are not used for animals in the
facility.
***Correct by 4/20/2023.

The facility had records for their dogs on hand, however APHIS 7005 had not been updated with 3 dogs' information.
APHIS 7005 is required to be maintained up to date of dogs on hand and can be important for animal health tracing.
Ensure that APHIS 7005 is kept up to date with each dogs' information.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2)  Direct
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
The facility had one puppy death in a litter yesterday and another puppy was observed by the facility to not be interested 
in suckling but has been taking some milk replacer.  The licensee was concerned this puppy's problems might be the 
same as the one that died but the attending veterinarian had not been contacted.  The puppy was observed to have moist 
gums but when compared with littermates' interest in suckling the dam, it was seen to be uninterested.  Lack of 
communication with the attending veterinarian on the health of this puppy might cause it to be in discomfort or have its 
condition worsen.   If an animal is unwell and the program of veterinary care does not instruct care for a condition, the 
facility must contact the attending veterinarian to have the animals evaluated and follow the attending veterinarian's 
treatment plan.   
***Correct by the end of 4/20/2023.  
NOTE:  The inspection was paused and the licensee contacted the attending veterinarian who plans to visit and observe 
the litter today. 
 
The facility has pyrantel stored and that has been used that expired 5/2021.  Expired medications might not work to 
prevent/treat conditions or might make animals sick.  Ensure that expired medications are not used for animals in the

facility. 
***Correct by 4/20/2023. 
2.75(a)(2)  Repeat
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The facility had records for their dogs on hand, however APHIS 7005 had not been updated with 3 dogs' information.  
APHIS 7005 is required to be maintained up to date of dogs on hand and can be important for animal health tracing.  
Ensure that APHIS 7005 is kept up to date with each dogs' information. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
 n
